text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus tomentosinervis is an Asian species of tree in the beech family. It has been found only  in southern China (Guizhou, Yunnan).Quercus tomentosinervis is a tree up to 20 meters tall. Leaves can be as much as 15 cm long, thick and leather, green and hairless on top but covered with brown woolly hairs on the underside.
text.External links: line drawing, Flora of China Illustrations vol. 4, fig. 380, drawings 1-5 at lower right
